programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: When police stop investigating the disappearance of a family of atheists, an intrepid journalist picks up the torch and hunts down a mastermind hell-bent on revenge who resulted to kidnapping, extortion and murder.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: After a brutal killing at a construction site, homicide detectives track down a suspect who they've been eyeing from the beginning.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: A deranged man terrorizes New York City in the late 1970s, leaving a trail of dead and wounded in his wake until a series of letters, a reluctant witness, and a parking ticket lead to his capture.

programme.title: It Takes a Killer
programme.desc: Police in rural Minnesota investigate the murder of a missing woman whose dead body is dumped next to an abandoned farmhouse.

programme.title: The Year That Rocked the World
programme.desc: A future world leader becomes the star of a reality series; the seeds for ISIS are sown as the former leader of Iraq faces justice; one man risks his life to combat supersize meals; a space-airline is born; exploring the red planet.

programme.title: Photowalks On Scripps News
programme.desc: Join former USA TODAY columnist Jefferson Graham as he brings viewers to the planet's most photographable places, takes them on a virtual photowalk and offers tips on getting great vacation photos with your phone.

programme.title: Photowalks On Scripps News
programme.desc: oin Jefferson Graham on a photowalk through Heber and Park City, UT, with some of his favorite photo spots and tips to use your smartphone to capture your own perfect pictures.

programme.title: Bright Now
programme.desc: Today, 24-hour forecasts are 95% reliable and 3-day forecasts are 80% reliable. How do scientists predict the weather and, each year, improve their predictions? It's a race against time using the latest technologies.

programme.title: Bright Now
programme.desc: High-tech tools are being used to evaluate youth baseball players. The question is can they outperform professional scouts?

programme.title: Breakthrough
programme.desc: Heart disease is the number one cause of death worldwide, but there are researchers frantically working to change that. Meet the people inventing the future of cardiac health, from new ways of imaging the body to the 3D printing a functioning heart.

programme.title: Breakthrough
programme.desc: The Greenland ice sheet, the last remnant of the Ice Age, is melting at an unprecedented rate. Today, scientists and researchers from all over the world are paying close attention to what could become a global catastrophe.

programme.desc: Twisted lovers terrorize a pizza store in California; in England, a man's mistress takes matters into her own hands when he won't leave his wife.

programme.title: Murderous Affairs
